items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued, because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely this afternoon, overnight tonight and into tomorrow morning. Water levels continue to remain high. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry road in Horning. Be ready to take action to protect your property, if flooding is expected. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Saturday 4th December 2021.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper River Derwent remains in force. River levels have risen as a result of rainfall and snowmelt over the past few days. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, Friday 03/12/2021. No further significant rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated on Friday afternoon 03/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.60 mAOD at 02:00 on 04/12/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 17 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 04/12/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: County Durham, Hartlepool, North Tyneside, South Tyneside, Sunderland

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
The risk of large waves and spray has now reduced, though standing water and debris may remain on coastal footpaths and promenades.
We continue to monitor the situation

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides.  Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides.  Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

Light winds and small waves with Friday evening's tide at 22:30 on 03/12/21 will generate minimal impacts. This message is issued for Saturday morning's tide at 10:45 on 04/12/21 which is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong Westerly Force 6 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.14 m. The total forecast tide is 6.23 metres Chart Datum (3.18 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide, minimal flood impacts are expected. A small amount of water could find its way behind the beach and may pond on nearby land and fields including at Climping Street Car Park and Mill Lane. Strong winds will continue until Sunday, but minimal flood impacts are expected as Saturday evening's tide should be 25 cm lower than in the morning. We continue to monitor the forecast. We recycled shingle in November and routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Shingle and debris can be thrown by large waves. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. Take care if visiting Climping beach. We will update this message by 14:00 on 04/12/21.

items.message: The flood alert for the lower river Derwent remains in force. River levels have risen as a result of snow-melt and rainfall. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible today, Friday 03/12/21. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated on Friday afternoon, 03/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal River Camel excluding Wadebridge and Chapel Amble
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Wednesday evening. High water at Padstow is at 04:44 and 17:08, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Strong force 7-8 north westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 4m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. 

Locations particularly at risk include the A389 at Sladesbridge 

Expect tides to be around 200mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. 

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.  

This message will be updated on Sunday morning.  There is a possibility that further alerts may be required for Monday morning’s high tide.

items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Wednesday evening. High water at Padstow is at 04:44 and 17:08, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Strong force 7-8 north westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 4m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Edge of quays likely to flood including any low lying car parks and roads with particular emphasis on Port Quinn, Port Isaac and Port Gaverne, Boscastle and Crooklets Beach 

Expect tides to be around 200mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. 

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.  

This message will be updated on Sunday morning.  There is a possibility that further alerts may be required for Monday morning’s high tide.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
This message has been updated for Saturday’s high tides. 

Flooding is possible over the high tide on Saturday morning and evening. High water at Padstow is at 04:44 and 17:08, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Strong force 7-8 north westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 4m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Edge of quays likely to flood including any low lying car parks and roads with particular emphasis on Trevaunance Cove, Perranporth, Newquay, Mawgan Porth, Trevone and Polzeath 

Expect tides to be around 200mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. 

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.  

This message will be updated on Sunday morning.  There is a possibility that further alerts may be required for Monday morning’s high tide.

items.description: North Cornwall coast from Lands End to Chapel Porth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Saturday morning and evening. High water at St Ives is at 04:28 and 16:51, times of high water will vary along the coast.
Strong force 7 to 8, north westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 4m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations including St Ives Harbour, Portreath Harbour and the Causeway at Hayle.
Expect tides to be around 200mm higher than predicted because of forecast weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.
This message will be updated on Sunday morning.  There is a possibility that further alerts may be required for Monday morning’s high tide.
